title: Craven Cottage
summary: Craven Cottage is a football stadium located in Fulham, West London. It has been the home ground of Championship club Fulham since 1896.[3] The ground's capacity is now 19,359,[1] which happened with the closure of the Riverside Stand for redevelopment in the close season of 2019. The record attendance is 49,335, for a game against Millwall, 8 October 1938.[4] Located next to Bishop's Park on the banks of the River Thames,[5] 'Craven Cottage' was originally a royal hunting lodge and has history dating back over 300 years.[6]
